meanings.definition: One of three equal parts of a whole
meanings.sent1: She divided the pizza into thirds to share with her friends.
meanings.sent2: The cake was cut into thirds so everyone could have an equal piece.
meanings.sent3: The teacher split the class into thirds for a fun group activity.
meanings.sent4: His heart felt like it was split into thirds, torn between love, duty, and desire.
meanings.sent5: The garden was divided into thirds, each section blooming with different flowers.

meanings.sent1: After the first and second tasks, it was time for the thirds on the list.
meanings.sent2: He always excelled in the thirds of the race, pushing himself to the limit.
meanings.sent3: The thirds in the line were getting impatient, tapping their feet and checking their watches.
meanings.sent4: As the thirds in the story unfolded, the plot took an unexpected turn.
meanings.sent5: The thirds in the song added a unique rhythm, making it catchy and memorable.

meanings.definition: A musical interval of three diatonic degrees
meanings.sent1: The melody soared with beautiful thirds harmonizing in the background.
meanings.sent2: The musician played the thirds on the piano, creating a harmonious sound.
meanings.sent3: The thirds in the music seemed to dance around each other, creating a magical atmosphere.
meanings.sent4: Her voice blended perfectly with the thirds in the choir, creating a heavenly sound.
meanings.sent5: The thirds in the symphony added depth and richness to the overall composition.
